001package tictactoe;
002
003import java.util.*;
004
005/**
006 * A ComputerPlayer that tries to block the player and to make moves that are somewhat smart.
007 * 
008 * <p>Calculates a priority for each square on the game board,
009 * based on the number of pieces in a row in each direction.
010 * The square with the highest priority will be selected.</p>
011 * 
012 * @author Tapio Malmberg
013 */
014public class SmartComputer implements ComputerPlayer {
015    /**
016     * The game board.
017     */
018    private ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard;
019    /**
020     * The number of pieces in a row needed to win.
021     */
022    private int numToWin;
023    /**
024     * The number of pieces in a row one move away from victory.
025     */
026    private int oneMoveToWin;
027    /**
028     * The number of pieces in a row two moves away from victory.
029     */
030    private int twoMovesToWin;
031    /**
032     * The calculated priority for each square on the game board.
033     */
034    private int[][] priorities;
035    /**
036     * The maximum calculated priority.
037     */
038    private int maxPriority;
039
040    /**
041     * Returns a Coordinate with the highest calculated priority.
042     * @param gameBoard the game board
043     * @param numInARowToWin the number of pieces in a row needed to win
044     * @return a Coordinate with the highest calculated priority
045     */
046    @Override
047    public Coordinate getMove(ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard, int numInARowToWin) {
048        this.maxPriority = 0;
049        this.gameBoard = gameBoard;
050        this.numToWin = numInARowToWin;
051        this.oneMoveToWin = numToWin - 1;
052        this.twoMovesToWin = oneMoveToWin - 1;
053        this.priorities = new int[gameBoard.getHeight()][gameBoard.getWidth()];
054
055        addPriorityForBlockingMoves();
056        addPriorityForPossibleMoves();
057
058        // If maxPriority is zero, this is either the first move,
059        // or winning the game is no longer possible.
060        if(maxPriority > 0)
061            return getHighestPriorityMove();
062        else
063            return getMiddlePositionOrRandomMove();
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Returns the Coordinate of the square that has the highest priority.
068     * 
069     * <p>If there are many squares that have the highest priority,
070     * the first one will be selected.</p>
071     * @return the Coordinate of the square with the highest priority
072     */
073    private Coordinate getHighestPriorityMove() {
074        // The selection could be randomized when there are many squares with maxPriority
075        for (int x = 0; x < priorities[0].length; x++) {
076            for (int y = 0; y < priorities.length; y++) {
077                if(priorities[y][x] == maxPriority)
078                    return new Coordinate(x, y);
079            }
080        }
081
082        return null;
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Calculates the priorities for moves that block the player.
087     * 
088     * <p>Uses a high "small boost" because if the player is
089     * two moves away from winning, the computer has to block
090     * the player, otherwise they will win.</p>
091     */
092    private void addPriorityForBlockingMoves() {
093        for (Direction direction : Directions.ALL)
094            addPriority(direction, TicTacToeGame.PLAYER, 100, 30);
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Calculates the priorities for moves that help the computer win.
099     * 
100     * <p>Uses a high "large boost" because if a winning move is available,
101     * the computer should take it and not try to block the player.</p>
102     */
103    private void addPriorityForPossibleMoves() {
104        for (Direction direction : Directions.ALL)
105            addPriority(direction, TicTacToeGame.COMPUTER, 300, 20);
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Adds priority for each square based on the number of pieces in a row in
110     * the given direction for the given player.
111     * @param dir the direction for counting the adjacent pieces
112     * @param player the human player or the computer player
113     * @param largeBoost the value added to the priority of a square that is one move away from victory
114     * @param smallBoost the value added to the priority of a square that is two moves away from victory
115     */
116    private void addPriority(Direction dir, int player, int largeBoost, int smallBoost) {
117        for (int y = 0; y < gameBoard.getHeight(); y++) {
118            for (int x = 0; x < gameBoard.getWidth(); x++) {
119                if(!isAvailable(x, y))
120                    continue;
121
122                Coordinate thisPos = new Coordinate(x, y);
123                Direction reverseDir = dir.reverse();
124                int adjacentForward = gameBoard.getNumAdjacent(thisPos, dir, player, false);
125                int adjacentReverse = gameBoard.getNumAdjacent(thisPos, reverseDir, player, false);
126                int spaceAvailableFw = gameBoard.getNumAdjacent(thisPos.move(dir, adjacentForward), dir, TicTacToeGame.EMPTY, false);
127                int spaceAvailableRev = gameBoard.getNumAdjacent(thisPos.move(reverseDir, adjacentReverse), reverseDir, TicTacToeGame.EMPTY, false);
128                int priority = adjacentForward + adjacentReverse;
129
130                // Discard this move if there is not enough space available for a winning row
131                if(1 + spaceAvailableFw + spaceAvailableRev + adjacentForward + adjacentReverse < numToWin)
132                    continue;
133
134                if(priority == oneMoveToWin) {
135                    priority += largeBoost;
136                } else if(priority == twoMovesToWin && (spaceAvailableFw != 0 && spaceAvailableRev != 0)) {
137                    // Boost the priority if both ends of a row are available
138                    // In this case it is vital that the human player is blocked
139                    priority += smallBoost;
140                }
141
142                increaseSquarePriority(x, y, priority);
143            }
144        }
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Increases the priority of the square at the (x, y) coordinate by the given amount
149     * and keeps track of the current maximum priority.
150     * @param x the x value of the square on the game board
151     * @param y the y value of the square on the game board
152     * @param priority the amount the priority of the square will be increased.
153     */
154    private void increaseSquarePriority(int x, int y, int priority) {
155        if(priority > 0) {
156            int newPriority = priorities[y][x] + priority;
157            priorities[y][x] = newPriority;
158            if(newPriority > maxPriority)
159                maxPriority = newPriority;
160        }
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Tests whether a square on the game board is available.
165     * @param x the x value of the square on the game board
166     * @param y the y value of the square on the game board
167     * @return true if the square at (x, y) is within the game board and it is empty
168     */
169    private boolean isAvailable(int x, int y) {
170        return gameBoard.isWithinBounds(x, y) && gameBoard.getPosition(x, y) == TicTacToeGame.EMPTY;
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Either returns the middle square of the game board,
175     * or if it is unavailable, a random square utilizing RandomComputer.
176     * @return the middle square or a random square
177     */
178    private Coordinate getMiddlePositionOrRandomMove() {
179        Coordinate middle = new Coordinate(gameBoard.getWidth() / 2, gameBoard.getHeight() / 2);
180
181        if (isAvailable(middle.x, middle.y))
182            return middle;
183        else
184            return new RandomComputer().getMove(gameBoard, numToWin);
185    }
186}
